titlePart.entryReference: arrangements of seats for, or adaptation of seats to, vehicles

noteParagraph.text: The term "furniture" in this class also covers easels or stands, e.g. for blackboards or drawing tables.
the term "tables" also cover tables or underframes therefor, for other than domestic use;
the terms "cabinets" and "racks" also cover cabinets and racks for storage in general.

titlePart.text: Tables or desks characterised by structural features
with insertable leaves and fixed frames
the leaves being foldable or revolvable
the leaves being extensible by drawing-out

titlePart.entryReference: folded and suspended or hinged, or wall tables
adjustable for varying height of tops

titlePart.text: with legs pivoted to top or underframe

titlePart.entryReference: in combination with foldable top leaves

titlePart.text: Stowable tables with detachable top leaves
Suspended or hinged panels forming a table
with legs for supporting the table on the floor
Tables with tops of variable height
with balancing device, e.g. by spring, by weight
with clamps acting on vertical rods
with flexible height-adjusting means, e.g. rope, chain
with means for, or adapted for, inclining the legs of the table for varying the height of the top, e.g. with adjustable cross legs
with additional top or additional legs for varying the height of the top
Tables with tops revolvable on vertical spindles
Tops characterised by shape, other than circular or rectangular
Holders for glasses, ashtrays, lamps, candles or the like forming part of tables
Tables or desks characterised by adaptation for particular purposes
with substantially horizontally extensible or adjustable parts other than drawers, e.g. leaves
with parts, e.g. trays, movable on a pivot or by chains or belts
Telephone desks, e.g. with book clamps, with shelves
characterised by association with auxiliary devices, e.g. paper clamps, line indicators
with substantially horizontally extensible or adjustable parts other than drawers, e.g. leaves
supported from table, floor or wall
characterised by association with auxiliary devices, e.g. line indicators, leaf turners, lampholders
titlePart.entryReference: spot indicators, leaf turners, per se
easels or stands for blackboards or the like

titlePart.text: Adjustable drawing tables without balancing means
Adjustable drawing-board carriers with balancing means for the board
Locking means, e.g. for locking inclination of board
Service or tea tables, trolleys, or wagons
titlePart.entryReference: features relating to running gear or to movement by hand

titlePart.text: with heating, cooling or ventilating means
adapted to the use in vehicles
Tables combined with ironing-boards, washers, wringers, or the like
titlePart.entryReference: washing machines, ironing boards, wringers per se

titlePart.text: Tables adapted for other particular purposes
Tables specially adapted to be used with domestic photographic projectors, e.g. tables with levelling arrangements
titlePart.entryReference: tables with adjustable inclination of the top , , ,

titlePart.text: Tables specially adapted for use in the garden or otherwise in the open air, e.g. with means for holding umbrellas or umbrella-like sunshades
Benches or forms combined with desks
Devices for holding pupils upright, i.e. body supports
Holders or supports for guiding copy-books, slates, or the like

titlePart.entryReference: storing articles in warehouses or magazines
built-in cupboards as part of a building
peculiar to housing recording apparatus or records therefor
peculiar to housing electrical apparatus or installations

titlePart.text: Cabinets, racks or shelf units, characterised by features enabling folding of the cabinet or the like
made of cardboard or the like
made of a rigid frame with walls or door-leaves of textile or the like
Cabinets, racks or shelf units, characterised by features enabling enlarging in height, length, or depth
Cabinets, racks or shelf units, having one or more surfaces adapted to be brought into position for use by extending or pivoting
Cabinets, racks or shelf units, characterised by features related to dismountability or building-up from elements
titlePart.entryReference: features for adjusting shelves or partitions

titlePart.text: with panels separate from the frame
made mainly of wood or plastics
with panels on a separate frame, e.g. a metal frame
made mainly of cardboard, textile, paper, or the like, e.g. with separate frame of other materials
Cabinets or racks with revolving parts
Cabinets with means for moving compartments up and down
Cabinets or racks having several sections one behind the other
Cabinet systems, e.g. consisting of cabinets arranged in a row with means to open or close passages between adjacent cabinets
Cabinets, racks or shelf units, having essential features of rigid construction
made of concrete or the like
made of cardboard, paper, or the like
Cabinets, racks or shelf units, characterised by features for adjusting shelves or partitions
titlePart.entryReference: details of cabinets, racks or shelf units in general

titlePart.text: with means for adjusting the inclination of the shelves
with means for adjusting the height of the shelves
consisting of grooved or notched ledges, uprights or side walls
the grooved or notched parts being the side walls or uprights themselves
consisting of side walls of the ladder type
with hooks on the shelves to engage the rungs of the ladder
consisting of hooks coacting with openings
consisting of screwbolts as connecting members
consisting of tongues, pins or similar projecting means coacting with openings
characterised by shape or orientation of opening, e.g. keyhole-shaped
consisting of clamping means, e.g. with sliding bolts or sliding wedges
with means for adjusting the height of detachable shelf supports
consisting of grooved or notched ledges, uprights or side walls
the grooved or notched parts being the side walls or uprights themselves
consisting of side walls of the ladder type
with hooks on the shelf supports to engage the rungs of the ladder
consisting of hooks coacting with openings
the shelf supports being cantilever brackets
consisting of screwbolts as connecting members
the shelf supports being cantilever brackets
consisting of tongues, pins or similar projecting means coacting with openings
characterised by shape or orientation of opening, e.g. keyhole-shaped
the shelf supports being cantilever brackets
consisting of clamping means, e.g. with sliding bolts or sliding wedges
the shelf supports being cantilever brackets
with means for adjusting partitions horizontally
for shoes, hats, umbrellas, or the like

specially adapted for storing drawings or the like

titlePart.text: with parts, e.g. trays, movable on pivots, or on chains or belts

titlePart.text: General layout, e.g. relative arrangement of compartments, working surface or surfaces, supports for apparatus

for incorporating apparatus operated by power, including water power
for incorporating apparatus for cooking, cooling, or laundry purposes

titlePart.entryReference: surfaces adapted to be brought into position for use by extension or pivoting in general

by incorporation of racks or supports, other than shelves, for household utensils
by adaptation of compartments or drawers for receiving or holding foodstuffs

by special arrangements for accommodating removable containers

specially adapted for storing cleaning utensils

with devices to prevent complete withdrawal
adapted to mounting on inclined floor
